page.title: 09BEING A TEACHER IN TOW LAW.
page.content:
There is no special age to be a teacher, though it is usual to go to college or university after leaving school at 18.
To be a teacher in a primary school you have to be able to teach all subjects. In Tow Law J.M. & I. School the class teachers enjoy their work very much. At the moment there are 7 class teachers, 1 part-time teacher and the head-teacher, Mr R.C. Baker.
There have been many changes of staff during the last 10 years or so, and the curriculum has changed too. The use of a computer is an example.
Both boys and girls are taught together for most of the time.
